intro: Seseli nitidum, commonly known as the smooth seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in umbrella-like clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is native to regions of southern Europe and western Asia. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a smooth texture and a slightly aromatic scent. Seseli nitidum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
